description: From Latin pecūliāris (“one's own”), from pecūlium (“private property”), from pecus (“cattle”).

adjectives.description: peculiar (comparative more peculiar, superlative most peculiar)

entries.meaning: Out of the ordinary; odd; strange; unusual.
examples: The sky had a peculiar appearance before the storm.
It would be rather peculiar to see a kangaroo hopping down a city street.

entries.meaning: Common or usual for a certain place or circumstance; specific or particular.
(dated) One's own; belonging solely or especially to an individual; not shared or possessed by others.
That which is peculiar; a sole or exclusive property; a prerogative; a characteristic.
examples: If anything can legalize revenge, it should be injury from an extremely obliged person; but revenge is so absolutely the peculiar of heaven.

entries.meaning: (UK, canon law) an ecclesiastical district, parish, chapel or church outside the jurisdiction of the bishop of the diocese in which it is situated.
